Download attachments and return the local path

Source: R/get_attachment.R
get_attachment.Rd

This function is vectorised and can handle either one or many records. Parameters submission_uuid and attachment_filename accept single or exactly the same number of multiple values. The other parameters are automatically repeated.

get_attachment(pid, fid, submission_uuid, attachment_filename,
  local_dir = "attachments", url = Sys.getenv("ODKC_URL"),
  un = Sys.getenv("ODKC_UN"), pw = Sys.getenv("ODKC_PW"),
  verbose = FALSE)

Arguments

pid

The numeric ID of the project, e.g.: 2.
fid

The alphanumeric form ID, e.g. "build_Spotlighting-0-8_1559885147".
submission_uuid

One or many ODK submission UUIDs, an MD5 hash
attachment_filename

One or many ODK form attachment filenames, e.g. "1558330537199.jpg"
local_dir

The local folder to save the downloaded files to, default: "attachments"
url

The OData URL, ending in .svc, no trailing slash.
un

The ODK Central username (an email address), default: Sys.getenv("ODKC_UN"). Add to your ~/.Rprofile: Sys.setenv(ODKC_UN="...@...")
pw

The ODK Central password,, default: Sys.getenv("ODKC_PW"). Add to your ~/.Rprofile: Sys.setenv(ODKC_PW="...")
verbose

Whether to display debug messages or not (default)

Value

The relative file path for the downloaded attachment(s)

Details

The media attachments are downloaded into a folder named by the submission's uuid inside the given `local_dir`. E.g.:

workdir/attachments/xxxxxxxxxx/filename1.jpg

workdir/attachments/xxxxxxxxxx/filename2.jpg

workdir/attachments/xxxxxxxxxx/filename3.jpg

Contents

  • Value
